intro: Phyllorkis coniphylis, commonly known as the mountain hakea, is a shrub native to the southeastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Phyllorkis coniphylis is often found in heathlands and rocky areas, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
